page.title: 05Gaddesden Row Primary School
page.content: I come to school by car. When I arrive I can go in to class. My headmaster teaches us all the time. There are{28 {children}aged 5 to 11 yrs. in two classes. We have our own cook and everyone stays to dinner. Our parents are painting the office and corridor. The headmaster has ripped the rotten wood from the large cupboard. Our school was opened in 1877. We have the {Log books.}We all go{swimming}each week. Our parents take us by car to Hemel. We can use the P.E. equipment at playtime. We have two tennis nets. We each have our gardens and there is a pond too. We have{pets}in class: Russian hamsters, gerbils, stick insects and a budgie. Our stock cupboard is full of things from the {Childrens' Scrap Project,}London. Our problems this year were frozen pipes, woodworm, dry rot, moles and wasps.
